byline.contributor: Alan Feuer, Matt Flegenheimer, James C. McKinley Jr. and John Surico contributed reporting.

abstract: New York City police charge Michael Verbitsky with second-degree assault for allegedly shooting two police officers with pellet gun outside Gracie Mansion, Mayor Bill de Blasio's official residence; Verbitsky is also charged with several misdemeanors related to earlier pellet gun incidents in area.
lead_paragraph: Michael Verbitsky, 19, was charged with second-degree assault and several misdemeanors, including reckless endangerment, criminal possession of a weapon and two counts of criminal mischief.

headline.main: Man Charged in Pellet Shooting of Officer Outside Gracie Mansion
headline.print_headline: Man, 19, Is Charged in Pellet Shooting of Officer

snippet: Michael Verbitsky, 19, was charged with second-degree assault and several misdemeanors, including reckless endangerment, criminal possession of a weapon and two counts of criminal mischief.
